user.title: Emergency Alerts Setup
user.description: Choose the type of Emergency Alerts hub to create:

data_description.setup_type: Choose 'Global Settings' to manage notification settings, or 'Alert Group' to create a group of related alerts

global_setup.title: Create Global Settings Hub
global_setup.description: This will create a hub for managing global notification settings that apply to all Emergency Alerts.

group_setup.title: Create Alert Group Hub
group_setup.description: Create a named group to organize related emergency alerts.

data_description.group_name: Enter a name for this alert group (e.g., 'Security', 'Safety', 'Ivan's Alerts')

abort.group_already_configured: This group hub is already configured

global_options.title: Global Emergency Alerts Settings
global_options.description: Configure global settings that apply to all Emergency Alerts.

data_description.default_escalation_time: Default time in seconds before alerts escalate if not acknowledged (60-3600 seconds)
data_description.enable_global_notifications: Send notifications for all emergency alerts using the global service
data_description.global_notification_service: Service to use for global notifications (e.g., 'notify.notify' or 'notify.mobile_app_phone')
data_description.global_notification_message: Template for global notification messages. Available variables: {alert_name}, {severity}, {group}, {entity_id}

group_options.title: Manage {group_name} Alerts
group_options.description: Choose an action to manage alerts in this group. Currently {alert_count} alert(s) configured.

add_alert.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert - Step 1: Basic Information
add_alert.description: First, let's set up the basic information for your new emergency alert.

data.name: Alert Name
data.trigger_type: How should this alert be triggered?

data_description.name: A descriptive name for this alert (e.g., 'Front Door Open', 'High Temperature')
data_description.trigger_type:
**Simple**: Monitor one entity's state
**Template**: Use Jinja2 for complex conditions
**Logical**: Combine multiple entity conditions
data_description.severity:
**Critical**: Urgent issues requiring immediate attention
**Warning**: Important but not critical
**Info**: General notifications

add_alert_trigger_simple.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert - Step 2: Simple Trigger
add_alert_trigger_simple.description: Configure which entity to monitor and what state should trigger the alert.

data_description.entity_id: The Home Assistant entity to watch (e.g., binary_sensor.front_door, sensor.temperature)
data_description.trigger_state:
What state should trigger the alert? Examples:
‚Ä¢ `on` for binary sensors
‚Ä¢ `unavailable` for offline devices
‚Ä¢ `30` for numeric thresholds

add_alert_trigger_template.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert - Step 2: Template Trigger
add_alert_trigger_template.description: Create a Jinja2 template that returns True when the alert should trigger.

data_description.template:
Jinja2 template returning True/False. Example:
`{{ states('sensor.temperature')|float > 25 and states('sensor.humidity')|float < 30 }}`

add_alert_trigger_logical.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert - Step 2: Logical Trigger
add_alert_trigger_logical.description: Combine multiple entity conditions using AND/OR logic. Add up to 10 conditions below.

data_description.logical_operator:
Choose how to combine the conditions:
‚Ä¢ AND - All conditions must be true
‚Ä¢ OR - Any condition can be true

add_alert_actions.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert - Step 3: Action Configuration
add_alert_actions.description: Choose which scripts to run when the alert is triggered, cleared, or escalated. Create scripts in Settings > Automations & Scenes > Scripts for advanced actions like notifications.

data.on_triggered_script: Script to run when alert triggers (optional)
data.on_cleared_script: Script to run when alert clears (optional)
data.on_escalated_script: Script to run when alert escalates (optional)

data_description.on_triggered_script: Select a script to run when the alert condition is met. Create scripts in Settings > Automations & Scenes > Scripts for notifications, automations, etc.
data_description.on_cleared_script: Select a script to run when the alert condition is no longer met (e.g., cleanup actions)
data_description.on_escalated_script: Select a script to run if the alert is not acknowledged within the escalation time (e.g., emergency notifications)

edit_alert.description: Choose which alert you want to edit or delete. You'll see all the current settings and can modify them or remove the alert entirely.

edit_alert_form.title: ‚úèÔ∏è Edit Alert
edit_alert_form.description: Modify the alert settings below, or choose to delete this alert entirely. All changes will take effect immediately.
